Posts.EditableText: I thought player.score was the score but apparently not. What is the id for player score.
Posts.HTML: I thought player.score was the score but apparently not. What is the id for player score.

Posts.EditableText: I thinkit is `game.score`. You cancreate games where the player jumps between different characters. Money and health would be associated with each character, but score is for all of them, so is on ther game object.
Posts.HTML: I thinkit is game.score. You cancreate games where the player jumps between different characters. Money and health would be associated with each character, but score is for all of them, so is on ther game object.

Posts.EditableText: The Pixie, are you speaking internet grammar, or should I take you to the hospital?
Posts.HTML: The Pixie, are you speaking internet grammar, or should I take you to the hospital?

Posts.EditableText:
the bad thing about coders/programmers:

for computer languages, we've got to be grammar/spelling nazis, else the code doesn't work...

but when it comes to human languages (normal typing/posting/writing), we're lazy, when we should be applying the same grammar/spelling nazism standards/work, lol

though, to be fair, the human brain works a lot better than (aka: parses automatically, unlike) a computer, so we can be lazy and still have others able to understand what we've said/typed, lol.

Pixie's missing spaces ('think-it' and 'can-create')  and the wrong grammar and missing 'e' on 'ther', doesn't impede our brain's ability to automaticlly and correctly parse and understand it, whereas a computer is not able to do so without being programmed to parse it correctly... which is VERY VERY NOT easy... to program in... understanding all of the intricies of human languages and its grammar and spellings...
